channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @SamuelSokol @shaynamalka Hey, marketing during wartime is hard!

@mollytolsky @RokhlK "In this witty, provocative, and unputdownable debut novel a young Hasidic woman on a quest to get married fears she will never find a groom because of her secret addiction to porn." https://t.co/IALeU79dZt
Read this as "Shatnez," which shows which gutter *my* mind is in. https://t.co/ItcInn5JVW
“I had been an unwitting pawn in a right-wing disinformation campaign to obscure the discourse around antisemitism.” https://t.co/NpBHoLnzT2
@prof_dainy @onthemainline Presumably the kids are now part of two blended families.
@onthemainline Love the unwitting Star Trek reference.
@DBashIdeas Also recommended for marriages.

@KatzOnEarth I also suspect, based on their age and urban upbringing, that they have a lot of unacknowledged racism that guides their response to progressive activists who are exemplified by the Squad.
@HannahLebovits Ah. I missed the indefinite article in your tweet.

@HannahLebovits Do you actually wear a lab coat in your corner of academia?
@HannahLebovits I wonder whether that would help or hurt with your field work.
@ithrewtheglass Does that mean you have a bootleg of his cover of Rainbow Connection?

Reminder: This is the approach explicitly and repeatedly advocated by the current Republican presidential front runner. https://t.co/NHqSgitlqz
Which is not to say that I will shed tears at the murder of Nancy Pelosi and the other quisling party leaders who refuse to fight back again the fascist enemy.
@JeffreyGoldberg Certainly Lipsky would not have let you get away with a clunky headline like that.
Your occasional reminder that for Republicans, freedom means the freedom to oppress other people. https://t.co/wDDqORPEyM

@ColemanRidge @ZachWeiner Heinlein has become this weird mix of genres: What if a pre-iPhone civilization made it to space with their slide rules and print magazines?
@ColemanRidge @ZachWeiner The very plot of Podkayne on Mars is set into motion because the magazines in the waiting room are boring. If she lived in the 21st century, she’d be watching TikTok on her phone and avoided a whole book’s worth of trouble.
@SeerSnively @ColemanRidge @ZachWeiner But he didn’t tell his readers that for another decade or so. You might say he was playing the long game.

@JBJones72 @ZachWeiner I suspect some of his puzzle books hold up, as well as classics like 1, 2, 3… Infinity. https://t.co/PqqYyqtZ90
@JBJones72 @ZachWeiner However, one should always review any media older than your kid through their eyes, a fact I discovered the hard way when I showed my tween daughter Captain Kirk’s Star Trek.
@trekonomics You mean the network owned by an oligarch with a Chinese ex-wife? https://t.co/lOT0e689gh
@EladNehorai Imagine not noticing that this is the theme of almost every animated kids movie and has been since Disney had the genre to itself.
@trekonomics Must be desperate if they’re willingly to do publicly burn an asset.

We need a new 19 Letters, written to a young baal teshuva, empathetic to their desire for community and purpose, but warning of the cost of swearing fealty to an authoritarian system incapable of self-reflection and change. https://t.co/Xp6Pkrjki0
@EladNehorai Happy almost-second anniversary to this piece by an op-ed columnist being elevated as an ethical thinker by Yeshiva University. https://t.co/Ssk5IZxUo3
@Baalbatish1 @DemocraticLuntz Far less memable! https://t.co/BO3BpUdrXr
@EladNehorai By the 1970s, people had forgotten why most Jews had fled Orthodoxy when they left Europe. Now we’re relearning it the hard way.
